intro: Ouratea intermedia, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue-black berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various birds and mammals.
